result.execSummary:
The defendant Shyan M. Lipp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara Co. Case No. 15CM71

miscConds.notes: Paid in full - Bond previously posted has been applied.
The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.  Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:52 PM:  Defendant Shyan M. Lipp in court with attorney John B. Selsing, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel admit receipt of Rev Order and Warrant.  No factual corrections offered.  Argument by DA.  Argument by Atty Selsing.   Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Imposes as to Ct 1:  90 days WCJ with 46 days TS credit with Huber and GT - balance of sentence to be served forthwith - Costs PIF.  Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-11-2016 02:30 pm
from Atty Selsing requesting adjournment - Granted by the Court
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-10-2016 11:30 am

15CM44, 15CM71, 15CM149, 15CM228 Cases called @ 9:21 a.m. Defendant Shyan M. Lipp in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15CM44 - NC. 15CM71 - NC. 15CM228: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CM228: Cts 2 & 3 - DRI. 15CM149: Cts 1 & 2 - DRI. 15FO139 - DRI. 15FO73 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. No statement by DE. Court orders: 15CM44 - Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 15CM71 - 30 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 1 day CFTS - I/S - 2 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs to include the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP.

 15CM228 - S/W 2 years probation concurrent w/ Ct 1 - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs to include the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA sample to be provided. 1 day CFTS. Appeal rights given.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Case Called @ 1:59 PM: Defendant Shyan M. Lipp in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  SPD requests substitution of Judge due to the other pending cases.    NGP entered by Court recognizing request for substitution.   ADA argues for cash bond w/conditions.  No objectiont to bond recommendation.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 09:15 am.
